availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Warren W. Clubb (Henry County farmer and soldier)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer and soldier. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Lived with his sister Sarah, following their parents death, which owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Recommended for lieutenant colonel of the Henry County Home Guard in October 1863.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District No. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 100; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 5; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Drennons Ridge Precinct Subdividion 63; "Warre W. Clubb," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=75290785&ref=acom) (accessed on May 4, 2017).
